analyze

public java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double>> analyze(EventSet unknown,
                                                                       java.util.List<EventSet> known)
Description copied from class: AnalysisDriver
Generic statistical analysis method (abstract). Analyze a given unknown EventSet in terms of its similarity (broadly defined) to elements of a Vector of EventSets of known authorship. Legacy code from WAY back. We should probably add a verify() method as well once the technology improves.

Specified by:
analyze in class AnalysisDriver
Parameters:
unknown - the EventSet to be analyzed
known - a vector of EventSets of known authorship
Returns:
a String representing the name of the author assigned

discriminantFunction

double discriminantFunction(double[][] newGroupMean,
                            double[][] newData,
                            double newPriorProbability)
Perform the discriminant function given the group mean, the data on which the function should be performed, and the prior probability for the current group.

generateTransformation

void generateTransformation(double[][] f,
                            int[] c,
                            int ng)
The LDA class should be fed an array of features, where each row represents one object from the training data, and each column is a single feature. An array of classifications must also be passed. These classifications are simply integers such that classifications[i] denotes the class to which the ith row of the features array belongs. Finally, the number of groups to be analyzed must be provided.

getClassification

public double[] getClassification(double[] data)
Get the classification assigned by LDA to a given set of features (a datapoint). Notice that, because the JMathTools package only works with double[][] matrices, we need to do some funky things (have double[1][x] matrices) to convert our data into the appropriate form needed to process it. We assign classification based on the maximum discriminant function (see previously referenced source in header). To plot the new data, we would plot the vector created from the values of the discriminant functions.

prelim

void prelim()
Provides the preliminary setup for the LDA by setting up the various variables which will be used in LDA.

printInfo

void printInfo()
Print out various variables used internally in the LDA class for testing purposes.
